cQuiz.question: Which of the following is a correct syntax to declare a variable in C?

Which keyword is used to define a constant in C?
How do you comment a single line in C?
Which operator is used for bitwise AND in C?

Which of the following is a valid integer data type in C?
Which of the following is the correct way to declare an array in C?
How do you declare a string in C?
What is the return type of a function that does not return any value?

Which of the following is used to define a constant in C?
What is the correct syntax to declare a pointer in C?
Which of the following is the correct syntax to use the malloc function in C?
How do you free dynamically allocated memory in C?
What is the purpose of the 'return' statement in a function?

choice.choiceName: To return a value to the caller

cQuiz.answer: To return a value to the caller

cQuiz.question: What is a pointer in C?

choice.choiceName: A variable that stores the address of another variable
A variable that stores a value
A function that returns a value
A constant that holds a value

cQuiz.answer: A variable that stores the address of another variable

cQuiz.question: How do you access the value of a variable through its pointer in C?
What is the correct syntax to define a structure in C?
What is the purpose of a union in C?

choice.choiceName: To store different data types in the same memory location
To store different data types in different memory locations
To define a collection of related variables

cQuiz.answer: To store different data types in the same memory location

How do you read data from a file in C?

choice.choiceName: To determine the size of a data type or variable

cQuiz.answer: To determine the size of a data type or variable

cQuiz.question: Which of the following is a preprocessor directive in C?
What does the 'malloc' function do in C?
Which function is used to release allocated memory in C?
Which of the following is a type of error that occurs during program execution?
How do you handle errors in C?

choice.choiceName: Using error handling functions like perror()

cQuiz.answer: Using error handling functions like perror()

cQuiz.question: What does the 'calloc' function do in C?

choice.choiceName: Allocates memory and initializes it to zero

cQuiz.answer: Allocates memory and initializes it to zero

cQuiz.question: Which of the following is used to check for dynamic memory allocation errors?

choice.choiceName: Checking if the pointer returned by malloc is NULL
Checking if the pointer returned by free is NULL
Checking if the pointer returned by sizeof is NULL
Checking if the pointer returned by struct is NULL

cQuiz.answer: Checking if the pointer returned by malloc is NULL

Which of the following is a function to allocate memory for an array in C?

course.cDescription: C# is a modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft as part of the .NET framework. It offers a robust type system, garbage collection, and support for multiple programming paradigms.

cQuiz.question: What is the correct file extension for C# source files?
Which of the following is not a valid C# data type?
What is the correct way to declare a constant in C#?
Which operator is used for string concatenation in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'using' keyword in C#?
Which of the following is the correct way to declare a variable in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'Console.WriteLine()' method in C#?

choice.choiceName: To print text to the console
To read input from the console

cQuiz.answer: To print text to the console

cQuiz.question: Which of the following is not a valid access modifier in C#?
What is the correct way to declare a single-line comment in C#?
Which of the following is used to read a line of text from the console in C#?
Which of the following is not a looping structure in C#?
What is the correct syntax for an if-else statement in C#?
Which keyword is used to define a method in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'break' statement in C#?

choice.choiceName: To exit a loop or switch statement
To skip the current iteration of a loop
To continue to the next iteration of a loop

cQuiz.answer: To exit a loop or switch statement

cQuiz.question: Which of the following is used to handle exceptions in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'return' statement in C#?

choice.choiceName: To exit a method and return a value
To print a value to the console

cQuiz.answer: To exit a method and return a value

cQuiz.question: Which of the following is not a valid parameter passing method in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'switch' statement in C#?
Which keyword is used to define an optional parameter in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'continue' statement in C#?

choice.choiceName: To skip the rest of the current iteration and move to the next one
To return a value from a method

cQuiz.answer: To skip the rest of the current iteration and move to the next one

cQuiz.question: What keyword is used to create a new instance of a class in C#?
Which of the following is not a pillar of Object-Oriented Programming?
What is the purpose of the 'virtual' keyword in C#?

choice.choiceName: To allow a method to be overridden in derived classes
To create a new instance of a class

cQuiz.answer: To allow a method to be overridden in derived classes

cQuiz.question: What is an interface in C#?

choice.choiceName: A contract that specifies a set of methods and properties
A class that cannot be instantiated
A method that returns multiple values
A type of loop in C#

cQuiz.answer: A contract that specifies a set of methods and properties

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'sealed' keyword in C#?

choice.choiceName: To prevent a class from being inherited

cQuiz.answer: To prevent a class from being inherited

cQuiz.question: What is the difference between an abstract class and an interface in C#?

choice.choiceName: An abstract class can have implementation, an interface cannot
An interface can be instantiated, an abstract class cannot
An abstract class supports multiple inheritance, an interface does not

cQuiz.answer: An abstract class can have implementation, an interface cannot

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'base' keyword in C#?

choice.choiceName: To call a method or constructor from a base class
To create a new instance of a class

cQuiz.answer: To call a method or constructor from a base class

cQuiz.question: What is method overloading in C#?

choice.choiceName: Having multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
Changing the implementation of a method in a derived class
Creating a new instance of a class

cQuiz.answer: Having multiple methods with the same name but different parameters

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in C#?

choice.choiceName: To refer to the current instance of the class
To create a new instance of a class
To call a method from a base class

cQuiz.answer: To refer to the current instance of the class

cQuiz.question: What is a constructor in C#?

choice.choiceName: A special method that is called when an object is created
A method that destroys an object
A method that returns a value
A keyword used to create a new instance of a class

cQuiz.answer: A special method that is called when an object is created

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of generics in C#?

choice.choiceName: To create type-safe and reusable code
To create instances of a class

cQuiz.answer: To create type-safe and reusable code

cQuiz.question: What does LINQ stand for in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'async' keyword in C#?
What is a lambda expression in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'yield' keyword in C#?
What is a delegate in C#?

choice.choiceName: A type that represents references to methods

cQuiz.answer: A type that represents references to methods

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'using' statement in C#?

choice.choiceName: To ensure the proper disposal of resources
To create a new instance of a class

cQuiz.answer: To ensure the proper disposal of resources

cQuiz.question: What is a nullable type in C#?

choice.choiceName: A value type that can also be assigned null

cQuiz.answer: A value type that can also be assigned null

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the 'event' keyword in C#?

choice.choiceName: To declare a member that clients can subscribe to
To create a new instance of a class

cQuiz.answer: To declare a member that clients can subscribe to

course.cDescription: React is a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications. It's used for handling the view layer for web and mobile apps.

cQuiz.question: What is React?

choice.choiceName: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

cQuiz.answer: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

cQuiz.question: What is JSX?
What is a React component?

choice.choiceName: An independent and reusable bit of code

cQuiz.answer: An independent and reusable bit of code

cQuiz.question: How do you create a functional component in React?
What is the correct way to render a component in React?
What does the 'render' method do in a React class component?

choice.choiceName: Returns the JSX to be rendered

cQuiz.answer: Returns the JSX to be rendered

cQuiz.question: How do you pass data from a parent component to a child component?
What is the purpose of state in React?

choice.choiceName: To store and manage component-specific data

cQuiz.answer: To store and manage component-specific data

cQuiz.question: What is the correct way to update state in a class component?
What is the purpose of the 'key' prop when rendering a list of elements?

choice.choiceName: To help React identify which items have changed

cQuiz.answer: To help React identify which items have changed

cQuiz.question: What are React Hooks?

choice.choiceName: Functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components
Methods for handling events in React

cQuiz.answer: Functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the useState hook?

choice.choiceName: To add state to functional components
To handle side effects in components

cQuiz.answer: To add state to functional components

cQuiz.question: What does the useEffect hook do?

choice.choiceName: Performs side effects in function components

cQuiz.answer: Performs side effects in function components

cQuiz.question: How do you declare state using the useState hook?
What is the correct way to update state using the useState hook?
What is the purpose of the dependency array in useEffect?

choice.choiceName: To specify when the effect should run
To handle errors in the effect

cQuiz.answer: To specify when the effect should run

cQuiz.question: What does an empty dependency array in useEffect mean?

choice.choiceName: The effect runs only once after the initial render
The effect runs after every render
The effect runs before the initial render

cQuiz.answer: The effect runs only once after the initial render

cQuiz.question: What is a custom hook in React?

choice.choiceName: A function that uses other hooks and can be reused across components
A built-in React hook with custom functionality
A method to create new React components
A way to add custom event listeners to components

cQuiz.answer: A function that uses other hooks and can be reused across components

cQuiz.question: What is the naming convention for custom hooks?

choice.choiceName: There is no specific naming convention

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the useContext hook?

choice.choiceName: To help React identify which items have changed

cQuiz.answer: To help React identify which items have changed

courseModule.name: Module 3: React Router and State Management

cQuiz.question: What is React Router used for?

choice.choiceName: Managing navigation in a React application

cQuiz.answer: Managing navigation in a React application

cQuiz.question: Which component is used to define a route in React Router?
What is the purpose of the Context API in React?

choice.choiceName: To provide a way to pass data through the component tree without passing props manually
To handle routing in React applications

cQuiz.answer: To provide a way to pass data through the component tree without passing props manually

cQuiz.question: What are the two main components of the Context API?
What is Redux?

choice.choiceName: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps

cQuiz.answer: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps

cQuiz.question: What are the three fundamental principles of Redux?

choice.choiceName: Single source of truth, State is read-only, Changes are made with pure functions
Multiple sources of truth, State is mutable, Changes are made with impure functions
Single source of truth, State is mutable, Changes are made with pure functions
Multiple sources of truth, State is read-only, Changes are made with impure functions

cQuiz.answer: Single source of truth, State is read-only, Changes are made with pure functions

cQuiz.question: What is an action in Redux?

choice.choiceName: A plain JavaScript object that describes what happened
A function that updates the state
A component that displays the state
A method that fetches data from an API

cQuiz.answer: A plain JavaScript object that describes what happened

cQuiz.question: What is a reducer in Redux?

choice.choiceName: A function that takes the current state and an action, and returns a new state
A component that renders the state
An object that stores the application state

cQuiz.answer: A function that takes the current state and an action, and returns a new state

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the useParams hook in React Router?

choice.choiceName: To access URL parameters in a component

cQuiz.answer: To access URL parameters in a component

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the useNavigate hook in React Router?

choice.choiceName: To programmatically navigate to different routes

cQuiz.answer: To programmatically navigate to different routes

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of React.memo()?

choice.choiceName: To memoize a component and prevent unnecessary re-renders

cQuiz.answer: To memoize a component and prevent unnecessary re-renders

cQuiz.question: What is the useCallback hook used for?
What is the purpose of the useMemo hook?
What is server-side rendering?

choice.choiceName: Rendering React components on the server instead of in the browser
Rendering React components only in the browser
A way to style React components
A method to handle form submissions

cQuiz.answer: Rendering React components on the server instead of in the browser

cQuiz.question: What is Next.js?
What is the purpose of the getServerSideProps function in Next.js?

choice.choiceName: To fetch data on the server for each request

cQuiz.answer: To fetch data on the server for each request

cQuiz.question: What is Jest?
What is the purpose of React Testing Library?

choice.choiceName: To test React components in a way that resembles how users interact with them
To handle routing in React applications

cQuiz.answer: To test React components in a way that resembles how users interact with them

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the act() function in React testing?

choice.choiceName: To wrap code that causes updates to components

cQuiz.answer: To wrap code that causes updates to components

cQuiz.question: What is the purpose of the cleanup function in React Testing Library?

choice.choiceName: To unmount components and clean up after each test

cQuiz.answer: To unmount components and clean up after each test
